page.title: 19Farming (sheet 2)
page.content: The soil of that part of Blackmoor Estate that lies within our D-block falls into three categories. (a) Upper Green Sand. This is found along the hill ridge that runs north -south down the western side of the block. It is very fertile and is used for the production of apples, pears and hops. Hops are being phased out due to the dropping demand for beer, and rising production costs. (b) Heavy, or Gault Clay. This runs eastwards from the ridge. The land is only 150 feet above sea level. It is very wet, and needs much drainage. It is used for growing cerials, mostly wheat, and for grass for dairy cattle. (c) Lower Green Sand. This lies in the vicinity of Blackmmoor Village, and covers the remainder of the block. The part within the Estate is used for growing orchard nursery stock.
